title: Why you should never chew gum on an airplane
text:
From Cosmopolitan

In case you didn't already know, there are a number of unwritten rules that come attached to getting on an airplane. Whether it's about the fizzy drink you should never order; the best way to beat jet lag, or even the perfect snacks to take on board.

Now, a travel doctor has revealed the surprising reason why you should never chew gum on a flight, despite the fact many passengers believe it to help stop your ears popping as you gain altitude.

Speaking to MailOnline, they explained that chewing gum can increase the amount of gas in your stomach, which in turn makes you bloat - and in turn contribute to that sluggish plane feeling.

Photo credit: Patrick Foto - Getty Images More

"Forget about chewing gum to stop your ears hurting at take-off or landing. Chewing makes us swallow more air – just like fizzy water," the travel doctor explained. "It’s also a choke-risk in turbulence or bumpy landings. Wiggling your lower jaw and doing some big fake yawns sorts your ears out more safely."

They went on to explain why it's for the same reasons you should try to avoid fizzy drinks. "Excessive gas is never fun on a plane. So why put extra oxygen into your system? Cutting out fizzy water (and saying no to Champagne, if you’re lucky enough to be offered it) makes everyone more comfortable."

We'll leave our Wrigley's at Gatwick, then.



Photo credit: Flightlevel80 - Getty Images More

Interestingly, this comes as an Emirates cabin crew member also revealed to Cosmopolitan UK the best way to avoid feeling puffy after a flight. "Alternate your seat position between upright and reclined at different points throughout your flight to avoid fluid pooling under your eyes," they explained. "You can also get rid of under-eye bags and puffiness by holding a wet napkin or ice cube under your eyes to help reduce any swelling."

Beyond your face, "Walk through the cabin during your flight or do circulatory exercises in your seat to get your blood flowing. This will relax your muscles and help you avoid any post-flight swollen ankle."

Consider us de-puffed.
